playTitle: The Totally Radical and Not at All Bogus Life of Jenny Mueller

stgdContent.tagContent: (JOSH is dumb-struck. SARA grins)

characterAction.tagContent: You know what else I know?
I know that you're going to be taking me to the Sadie Hawkins Friday.

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA nods slowly, assuredly)
(SARA adjusts JOSH's collar and dusts off his shoulder)

characterAction.tagContent: I'll be ready at 7, and I don't like to be kept waiting.
You wouldn't keep a girl like me waiting, now would you?

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA plays wounded. JOSH shakes his head violently)
(SARA turns to exit)
(SARA winks. She begins to exit)

characterAction.tagContent: Wait! I don't even know your name!

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA turns to answer him)
(Before SARA can finish, she is interrupted by MR. WHITE. The scene swirls around and evolves into a classroom)
(MR. WHITE is standing by his desk. Everyone is turned around watching JENNY as she sketches at her desk)
(JENNY is taken out of her daydream, looking up at the rest of the class)

(Some of the class starts to laugh. Before she can figure out what is going on, the bell rings, and students all start to get up. JENNY jumps to her feet, accidentally knocking a sheet of paper to the floor. Before she notices, BRITTANY, HEATHER, and TIFFANY, the ubiquitous mean girl trio walk by, pick it up, and look at it)
(The TRIO look at it, realize what it is, and laugh)

characterAction.tagContent: Is that supposed to be you?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY realizes what they are looking at, and quickly reaches for it)
(JENNY keeps trying to grab it from the trio, as they pass it between each other over the following:)

characterAction.tagContent: does somebody have a little bitty crush on the new kid?
You don't actually think he'd even want to be seen with you in the hallway, let alone at the dance, do you?
Yuck. Gag me with a spoon. I don't even want to be seen with you right now, and that's just in front of Brittany and Tiffany.

stgdContent.tagContent: (HEATHER and TIFFANY both nod in disgust. They all look at each other. JENNY reaches for her drawing, and it tears in two. JENNY is heartbroken)

characterAction.tagContent: Take a chill pill, nerd girl. It's not like we were going to keep it.
Yeah, we try to make it a rule not to be seen holding onto little pieces of trash.

stgdContent.tagContent: (TIFFANY hands HEATHER the ripped half of the sheet. BRITTANY signals HEATHER to throw the sheet. HEATHER is confused)

characterAction.tagContent: Good point, Tiffany. We totally shouldn't even be seen standing next to it.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY rips the sheet from HEATHER's hand, crumples it up, and throws it at JENNY)

characterAction.tagContent: Let's get out of here. Later, dweeb!

stgdContent.tagContent: (The TRIO laugh and exit. JENNY slumps to the ground and picks up the crumbled paper. She flattens it out on the floor)

sceneStructure.sceneDescription: LIGHTS UP on a group of guys sitting together at one end of a table, joking around. Nearby a group of girls are all talking with each other and laughing. Until: Enter SARA. Jackson Browne's "Somebody's Baby" is playing. Everyone turns to look at her. JOSH stands up from the group of guys. SARA walks right up to him. He glances her over, completely taken aback.

characterAction.tagContent: I wonder why they call it magic tape? Seems like regular old tape to me.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY rubs the drawing one last time. Trying her best to flatten it back out)

characterAction.tagContent: I wish you were real. I bet you wouldn't take crap from Brittany.

stgdContent.tagContent: (Interrupting her moment, MISSY enters)
(JENNY quickly looks up nervously, but once she realizes that it's only MISSY, she relaxes. JENNY reaches and turns off the radio)

characterAction.tagContent: Hey you. I didn't see you in math earlier today. Is everything okay?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY looks away)

characterAction.tagContent: Yeah. I just... wasn't feeling great, so I went home early.

And it doesn't have anything to do with three particular airheads that are known to torment half the senior class whenever they're bored, or confused. Which is, literally every moment they miraculously remember how to breathe and walk at the same time?

stgdContent.tagContent: (This makes JENNY laugh a little)

characterAction.tagContent: Maybe it had a little to do with that.
But I really wasn't feeling good either!
Yeah, hearing them talk always makes me want to barf too.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY laughs a lot more at this)

characterAction.tagContent: Nothing? Don't tell me you made me sit through Mr. Foote's monotone lecture about acute angles alone for "nothing".

stgdContent.tagContent: (MISSY stares at JENNY)

characterAction.tagContent: Nothing new. Just the same old junk. They grabbed my.. drawing here
, and then started picking on me like they always do.

stgdContent.tagContent: (MISSY looks at the drawing)
(JENNY quickly regrets showing her drawing to MISSY and covers it)

characterAction.tagContent: Yo, is that the new kid you were telling me about? What's his name? Jake?
Josh. And it doesn't matter because that's one thing Brittany was actually right about. There's no way a guy like that would want to go to the dance with someone like...

stgdContent.tagContent: (MISSY gives JENNY an annoyed mother-like stare)
(JENNY looks away)

characterAction.tagContent: Jenny. Mueller. Don't listen to what the ditz or her airhead friends say about you for a single second. Do you know that last week in history, I saw Heather try and spell President Reagan's name? R-A-Y-G-U-N.

I'm serious. That airhead is a major spaz. Do you really think that someone who would have likely wrote-in President Ray-gun for a third term knows the first thing about who you are, or what you're about?
Then don't let her get into your head with all this crap. You, Jenny Mueller, are one bodacious babe, and if this Jake g-
If this Josh guy is even half as great as you seem to think he is, he's going to see that too. You got that?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY frowns a moment, and then shrugs. MISSY glances back at the drawing now that JENNY isn't covering it anymore)

characterAction.tagContent: You know, I wish you'd let yourself be a little more like the Jenny you put in your comics.
"They're not comics, they're drawings", I know, I know. But I'm serious, Jenny. The only difference between you and her, is that she's not letting anyone hold her back from what she really wants.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY pins her drawing up on her wall near other drawings)

characterAction.tagContent: Well she's not real. No matter how much I sometimes wish she were. That's just not me.
Can we just... talk about something else?
Fiiine. I was gonna see if you wanted to go to the mall and grab a slice of pizza, but I'm not sure that would be such a good idea. You know, with you not feeling well and all...
Hmm. That's weird. I am suddenly feeling a whole lot better.
I've been told I have that effect on people.

stgdContent.tagContent: (MISSY and JENNY laugh. JENNY turns out the lights and the two exit. Only the drawing is shown on JENNY's wall. It is a projection After a few moments, the drawing begins to move. SARA, Jenny's alter-ego, begins to look around in the drawing. She eventually looks out at the real world, and starts running and leaps towards the stage and all lights go out. SPOT UP on SARA, who is a real person now. She has a brief moment to take it all in and then: JENNY re-enters and turns the lights back on. JENNY is looking back offstage)

characterAction.tagContent: I just forgot my windbreaker. I'll be rig-

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA takes in JENNY. She doesn't look too surprised. JENNY is frozen for a moment)

characterAction.tagContent: Uh- Who are you? What are you doing here?
What?! What do you mean "I'm you"?
Exactly that. I'm you. And you're me. We're the same. Well, close enough.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY is thoroughly confused)
(JENNY looks at her drawing, which is now blank)

characterAction.tagContent: No. No. No, no, no, no, this isn't possible.
I assure you that it is.
You used "magic" tape? Then you made a wish? Seems pretty obvious to me.
That is the most ridiculous thing I have ever heard. No one in their right mind would ever believe something so-

stgdContent.tagContent: (MISSY re-enters)

characterAction.tagContent: Are you com- Oh, my, God. She's real. How?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY looks at SARA)
(SARA looks to JENNY. "See"?)

characterAction.tagContent: This is going to be so much fun.

stgdContent.tagContent: (MISSY looks at JENNY)
(JENNY grabs her windbreaker, and they all exit)

sceneStructure.sceneDescription:
LIGHTS UP on Jenny's room. JENNY is sitting at a desk, flattening and taping up her drawing from before. Kim Carnes'"Bette Davis Eyes" is playing from her boombox.

JENNY examines her attempt at fixing the drawing and sighs. She picks up the tape dispenser and reads the label.

characterAction.tagContent: Welcome to Shermont High School. If you're anything like Jenny here, I am sure you'll get along just fine.
(MR. WHITE gives JENNY a look and a wink)
And I'll keep an eye out for your transfer paperwork. No idea why it hasn't come in already. In the meantime, feel free to shadow Jenny here until we get your own schedule.

stgdContent.tagContent: (MR. WHITE turns and exits. As soon as MR. WHITE is gone, ASHLEY turns to JENNY and SARA)
(SARA gives a pose as to say "In the flesh". JENNY looks at MISSY)

characterAction.tagContent: What? We tell each other everything! You know that!
Ev-ry-thing. I don't make the rules.
So how did you do it?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY and MISSY turn back to SARA and ASHLEY)
(ASHLEY points to SARA)

characterAction.tagContent: You don't need to talk about me like I'm not right here. I can speak, you know.
Oh. I'm sorry. It's just... this is so weird. But, like "cool" weird. I was just wondering how it even happened. Like, did you use a computer or something, like that movie?

stgdContent.tagContent: (MISSY leans in to ASHLEY)
(JENNY shakes her head)

characterAction.tagContent: Okay, but we can't tell anyone else, agreed? We were lucky enough to get her enrolled here. We don't need anyone asking about who she is or where she came from any more than they already do.
I don't see what the big deal is. We can just tell people I'm your sister.
Noo. We can't tell people you're my sister. No one will believe that I have some sort of long lost twin.
Compared to the truth, that's actually not that hard to believe.
Whatever. You guys figure it out. I'm going to grab a drink.

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA walks over to grab a drink of water, while JENNY, MISSY, and ASHLEY discuss a plan)
(After SARA takes a sip from the fountain, JIMMY comes walking up beside her and leans against the wall)
(SARA stands up, and JIMMY does a double take)

characterAction.tagContent: Do you come with a reset button or something?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JIMMY shakes his brain)

characterAction.tagContent: Did you do something different with your hair?
I'm sorry, do I know you?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JIMMY looks confused. After a moment, SARA nods slightly and turns to leave. This wakes JIMMY up)

characterAction.tagContent: Hey! Don't do me like that. You know me! C'mon. It's me Jimmy. The Jimster. Jimba-lia. Jim-Jam.
I instantly regret saying that last one. Please don't ever call me that. I beg you.

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA turns to engage with JIMMY when JENNY, MISSY, and ASHLEY come walking up. They panic and come running to the rescue)
(JIMMY turns and sees JENNY. He nods and turns back to SARA)
(JIMMY freezes. He slowly turns back to JENNY, then to SARA. He is becoming more and more confused by the second)

characterAction.tagContent: Uh, Who i... What is goi.. wait, who is this?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY and MISSY give ASHLEY a "What Are You Talking About?" look. ASHLEY shrugs)

characterAction.tagContent: I've known you since you were four years old. You don't have a sister. I'd know if you did.
No. She's not my sister. She's.. um..

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY looks to MISSY for help. MISSY is at a loss. SARA extends her hand to JIMMY)

characterAction.tagContent: My name is Sara. I'm Jenny's cousin. Our mothers are sisters. That's what she meant.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY, SARA, ASHLEY, and MISSY have a silent fight over JIMMY's head. They freeze as he looks to them)

characterAction.tagContent: Oh. Doy. Yeah. I mean, I was going to say you two don't even look that much alike. Like, Jenny, you're like.... uh...
(Looking at JENNY, ASHLEY, and MISSY and nodding)

stgdContent.tagContent: (JIMMY leaves. The girls shake their heads and laugh)

characterAction.tagContent: Yeah, Jimmy's been following us around as long as I can remember. He's got a major thing for Jenny.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY rolls her eyes. They start to walk away when BRITTANY, HEATHER, and TIFFANY walk up)

characterAction.tagContent: Oh look, now there's two of them. Barf me out. Just when I thought it couldn't get any worse.
I didn't know there was a 2 for 1 sale at Grodys"R"Us.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY and HEATHER laugh. TIFFANY looks uncomfortable)

characterAction.tagContent: , like, what's your damage? Are you some sort of spaz?
Not at all. I've just heard you get confused a little easily, and I wanted to make sure I didn't overload you with new information.

stgdContent.tagContent: (TIFFANY tries to stifle a small giggle, but not before BRITTANY notices)

characterAction.tagContent: Oh, you think that is funny, Tiffany?
Well, while we're telling jokes, maybe we should talk about the time you somehow scored lower on your spelling test than Heather here.
But yeah, that's like wicked bad. I sometimes put an A in my own name.

stgdContent.tagContent: (Long beat)

characterAction.tagContent: Your name is Heather. There is an A in it.

stgdContent.tagContent: (HEATHER thinks about this)

characterAction.tagContent: Well, like... then... sometimes I forget to put an A in it

stgdContent.tagContent: (Bam! Like she won the argument somehow. This whole exchange has taken the wind out from under Brittany's rant)

characterAction.tagContent: Did you need something else, or do you just like being seen around us?
Let's go before we catch whatever it is that makes them look like that.
It's called class. You should get some.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY rages off and HEATHER is close behind her. TIFFANY covers another smile to SARA, and then follows them off ASHLEY and MISSY are shocked. JENNY seems a bit uncomfortable)

characterAction.tagContent: I've never seen anyone talk to Brittany like that before.
She's just a person. You guys make her much more than she is.
She's not a person. She's a demon.
She is just going to be even more trouble now. Don't you realize that? I wish you would just leave her alone.
Yeah, like I do. There's a reason I don't engage with the trio. The more you fight back, the more they seek you out.
If you don't engage, why do they keep seeking you out then?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY has no real answer to this. She is getting a little worked up)

characterAction.tagContent: Whatever. You don't know them like I do. Just trust me, Brittany's not going to leave us alone just because you stood up to her.
Okay. Look, I'm sorry. I just don't like the way she tries and walks all over you. I thought that was why you wanted me here in the first place.
Who said I wanted you here?

stgdContent.tagContent: (Awkward pause)

characterAction.tagContent: It's okay. Let's just... get to class. Alright?

stgdContent.tagContent: (MISSY and ASHLEY uncomfortably nod along)

characterAction.tagContent: Yeah, it's fine. Let's just go before we're late.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY exits. MISSY follows)

sceneStructure.sceneDescription: LIGHTS UP on SARA, JENNY, MISSY, ASHLEY, and MR. WHITE who are gathered around. MR. WHITE hands SARA a form.

characterAction.tagContent: Are all classes as hard to sit through as Mr. White's?
Not all of them. Ms. Keating's Science class is actually pretty rad.
Some are worse though. Just wait until Math. Mr. Foote is Totally Bogus.
No wonder you had so much time to draw me.

stgdContent.tagContent: (Belinda Carlisle's "Heaven is a Place on Earth" starts to play as JOSH enters with a tray of food and sits down a few tables over from the girls. They all look over at him. JENNY is staring)

characterAction.tagContent: I don't see what's so special about him.
Someone better get Jenny a napkin before she drools all over her lunch.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY shakes awake)

characterAction.tagContent: I'm not drooling. I'm just... admiring.
Then why don't you eliminate the "from afar" part and go on over there.
Yeah, look, he's sitting all by himself. It's like he's asking for someone to come and talk to him.
C'mon. I thought you wanted to ask him to the Sadie Hawkins?
I bet the version of you in your drawing woul-

stgdContent.tagContent: (MISSY realizes what she just said, and everyone falls into an awkward silence. SARA tries to break the tension)

characterAction.tagContent: Guys, lay off, alright? I'm sure if Jenny wanted to go over and ask him, she would.

stgdContent.tagContent: (MISSY and ASHLEY nod sheepishly. JENNY grows determined)

characterAction.tagContent: No, you know what. You're right.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY stands up, and begins to walk to JOSH. MISSY, ASHLEY, and SARA all whisper in shock as JENNY walks confidently right up to JOSH. Much like SARA did in her drawing. The same music is playing. Everyone except JOSH is looking on in similar ways to the opening scene)
(JOSH has food in his mouth. He didn't even notice her walk up)

(A record scratches as the music cuts out. The following begins like the first scene, but JOSH is less dumbstruck, and more confused. This leads to JENNY becoming less confident over the conversation)
(Awkward pause)

characterAction.tagContent: You know what else I know?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JOSH looks around. Is someone messing with him?)

characterAction.tagContent: Uh, no. What else do you know?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY starts to panic. She looks at his lunch tray)

characterAction.tagContent: The um, dinner rolls. They, uh, use the same order all week. So while they're fresh on Mondays, by Friday they are as hard as a rock.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JOSH looks at his tray and then back to JENNY)

characterAction.tagContent: Of course. I mean, I know you're new here, and I'd hate for you to have them on a day like today, and like, totally love them, and then try and take a big bite on Friday, only to chip a tooth or something. Y'know?

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA has makes her way over to JENNY)

characterAction.tagContent: Oh, hey! There you are! You will not believe this thing I have to show you over here.

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA pulls JENNY away. JENNY has a mortified frozen look on her face)

characterAction.tagContent: I warned him about Friday bread.

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA lets JENNY slump back into her seat. ASHLEY, JIMMY, and MISSY try and console her)

characterAction.tagContent: I totally wish someone had warned me about Friday bread when I started here.
You probably just saved him a trip to the dentist!
Why don't we head to the bathroom. Okay?
We'll catch you two in Science?

stgdContent.tagContent: (MISSY and ASHLEY nod. SARA helps JENNY up, and the two of them leave. After a few moments. JIMMY looks around, and grabs the bread from JENNY's lunch tray. MISSY gives him an incredulous look)
(MISSY shakes her head)

sceneStructure.sceneDescription: LIGHTS UP on JENNY, SARA, MISSY, JIMMY, and ASHLEY who are just sitting down talking. Across the cafeteria, students are sitting at tables eating.

characterAction.tagContent: ...but whatever you do, don't eat the rolls. I ate them once, and that's how I became a total spaz!

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY and SARA enter and notice that they are mocking JENNY. JENNY begins to leave but sits down instead, SARA sits down a seat over from her. BRITTANY and HEATHER keep laughing, but JENNY ignores them. BECCA enters with a well made planet diorama. She carefully places it one desk behind JENNY. BRITTANY walks over to JENNY)

characterAction.tagContent: Hey, I noticed you left lunch early. I wasn't sure if you had enough time to eat, so I got you this.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY places the roll on the desk. JENNY ignores her, and turns to face a different way. BRITTANY notices BECCA's project and picks it up before BECCA can stop her)
(BRITTANY moves back toward JENNY. BECCA stares on worriedly)

characterAction.tagContent: You see, someone like Josh is this
. Sure he's hot, but like, he's at the center of everything. You, on the other hand, are this right here
. You're tiny. Insignificant. So far from everything that no one would even notice if you floated off into space.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY plucks Pluto off the diorama, and flicks it away. BECCA yelps. SARA stands up)

characterAction.tagContent: I wasn't talking to you, poser.
I'm just saying that if anyone here was a poser, I'd think it was the one trying ever so desperately to appear relevant.
You see, I already forgot how easily she gets confused.
Now give that back, sit down, and shut up.

stgdContent.tagContent: (The room goes quiet)
(SARA stares down BRITTANY. Finally JENNY gets up, between them)

characterAction.tagContent: Enough! Brittany, just please give that back to Becca. This has nothing to do with her.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY looks from SARA, to JENNY, and back)
(BRITTANY moves to hand it to JENNY, but right before JENNY can grab it, BRITTANY drops it, breaking it in half)
(BRITTANY notices MS. KEATING walk in)

characterAction.tagContent: Oh no! I thought you had it!
What? No! I would never do that!

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA notices MS. KEATING)

characterAction.tagContent: No. She needs to hear this.
All you do is make fun of other people, because if you stopped, for even a second, you'd have to come to terms with the fact that like no one actually likes you. You're just a wastoid. And-

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY is faking being incredibly hurt)
(JENNY turns to see MS. KEATING)

characterAction.tagContent: Ms. Keating. It's not what it looks like.
Oh? Because it looks like you're bullying Miss Maddox here.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY is mid sobs now)

characterAction.tagContent: I don't know what her problem is, Ms. K. I was just trying to hand her Becca's awesome planet thing, and it fell. I think she did it on purpose.

stgdContent.tagContent: (MS. KEATING makes a motion to have JENNY follow her out to the hall. SARA moves to help BECCA grab the diorama. The scene shifts and we are now in the hallway with MS. KEATING and JENNY. Before MS. KEATING has a chance, JENNY jumps right in)

characterAction.tagContent: She's lying, Ms. Keating. I swea-

stgdContent.tagContent: (MS. KEATING stops her with a motion of her hand)

characterAction.tagContent: Jenny. Do I look like someone who was born yesterday?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY doesn't know how to respond)
(MS. KEATING stops her with a look this time)

characterAction.tagContent: Then do you really think that I would believe for one second that Miss Maddox has ever felt that sorry for anything in her life, let alone something that belongs to another person?
I'll deal with her myself. But what concerns me the most at this moment is what I walked in on.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY looks ashamed)

characterAction.tagContent: I've never heard anything negative ever come from your mouth before, but what I just saw... What's going on, Jenny?

Nothing? Jenny, I just saw you tearing down Brittany with my own eyes. Now, from what I know of Miss Maddox, I can't say that she didn't deserve some of that. Lord knows I've had to hold back a few times myself, but that's not like you, Jenny. So I ask again, what's going on?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY hesitates)

characterAction.tagContent: I'm sorry, Ms. Keating. I just lost control for a moment. She's just so rotten sometimes, ya'know? I don't know why she hates me so much, but it's like she has it out for me. And, well, I guess I just had enough of her walking all over me.

stgdContent.tagContent: (MS. KEATING thinks this over for a moment)

characterAction.tagContent: Look, believe it or not, it wasn't that long ago I was sitting on the other side of the desk, so I know how hard it can be. The demands, the pressure... the bullying.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY is shocked at this)

characterAction.tagContent: Yeah, of course I was, or did you think being really into science used to be much cooler than it is now?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY laughs)

characterAction.tagContent: My point is, there are more productive ways to stand up for one's self than by tearing down others. The name calling, the insulting? That's her thing. That doesn't mean it needs to be yours. Got it?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY nods)

characterAction.tagContent: Yeah. I got it. I'm sorry.
Okay. Now if you'll excuse me, I think I have to go deal with what I expect to be a very distraught Miss Campbell. (beat) That was Becca's project, yes?
Yes. I really am so sorry. She didn't have anything to do with what happened. I'll help her fix wh-

Don't worry about it. She'll be fine. But no, if you come back in right now, without looking like I just laid into you, I'll get accused of playing favorites. How about you take the rest of the period off to get some air. I'll give your homework to Missy.
Thanks, Ms. Keating, but I don't think that will be-
That wasn't a suggestion, Miss Mueller. I think you need to take some time to think about how you handle such situations in the future. You understand?

stgdContent.tagContent: (MS. KEATING gives JENNY a light smile, and walks back into the classroom. JENNY sighs)

sceneStructure.sceneDescription:
LIGHTS UP on Ms. Keating's Science class. Students begin filing in.

BRITTANY, HEATHER, and TIFFANY stand around making fun of what they just saw in the cafeteria. BRITTANY even has a dinner roll as a prop.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY looks up)

characterAction.tagContent: So, um, Missy and Ashley were going to head over to the mall. And uh, we thought maybe you'd like to come?
No thanks. I think I'm just going to head home. It's been a long day.
Okay. Yeah, you're right. I'll just go tell them we'll see them tomorrow.
You can still go, you know. You don't need to hover around me at all times.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JIMMY walks on, but stays back)

characterAction.tagContent: I know. I just thought tha-
Contrary to popular belief, I managed just fine before you. Some may even say I was even better off then.
If by better you mean taking everyone's crap, and not going for what you really wanted, then sure.
You know what? I do. At least then I didn't get thrown out of class, or make a complete fool of myself in front of the entire school. I was better off without you, and I still am.
I see. Well, if you need me, I'll be at the mall with Missy and Ashley.
I guess I'll just spend the night at Missy's then?
Do whatever you want. That's what you're all about anyway, right? Do whatever you want, screw the consequences?
No? Well you could have fooled me.

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA exits. After a moment, JIMMY walks up)
(JENNY jumps and finally notices JIMMY)

characterAction.tagContent: I'm sorry, I didn't mean to snoop, but I just overheard the end of that.
Yeah, and? You going to tell me I'm doing everything wrong, too?
Do you know how long I've known you?
(shrugging) I don't know... like fourteen years?
Thirteen years, two months, three weeks, and six days. Do you know how long I've liked you?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY smiles)

characterAction.tagContent: Thirteen years, two months, three weeks, and a day.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY laughs)

characterAction.tagContent: What about those other five days?
We were four. I was pretty sure you had cooties or something at first.
Ha. Oh, then you realized I didn't?
No. I just realized I didn't care.
Look, Jenny. My point is that I know you better than anyone at this school. Probably even better than you know yourself. Definitely better than your cousin, or whatever you say she is, does.
Look, you like this Josh guy, right? And you want to ask him to the dance? Then ask him.
Did you not see me humiliate myself at lunch today?
Oh, I saw that. But that wasn't you asking him. That was you trying to be someone else asking him. That's what went wrong.

The Jenny I know doesn't need to fake some sort of wannabe cool-girl persona. The Jenny I know, the real Jenny, doesn't need any of that, because she's already the coolest person I know. And if that Jenny had walked up to this Josh guy, and asked him out, I think it would have had a much different result.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY is touched. She takes this all in)

characterAction.tagContent: You know, I'm a little surprised you'd be so willing to help me ask another guy out. Seems a little counter productive to your life goal of winning me over, doesn't it?

Nah. You'll spend half a night with this guy and realize he is missing that Jimmy charm you've grown to love. It's all just part of a larger plan to make you realize what you're missing with The Jimster.
You know I'm never going to call you that, right?
So you going to catch up with your cousin and your friends?
No. I think I need some Jenny time tonight.
I could use some Jenny time myself?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JIMMY starts to exit)

characterAction.tagContent: Thanks again. I think I needed to hear that.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JIMMY nods, and exits. JENNY sits back down, thoughtfully)

sceneStructure.sceneDescription: LIGHTS UP on JENNY sitting on a stoop. Her head is hanging in her hands. SARA walks up.

stgdContent.tagContent: (They smile at each other, and SARA begins to move past. BECCA hangs by for a second, and then stops SARA)

characterAction.tagContent: Hey, I just wanted to thank you for your help yesterday putting my project back together.
Really, it was the least I could do. I'm sorry if anything I did led to Brittany messing with it in the first place.
Are you kidding? Brittany Maddox doesn't need anyone's help to be evil, she does that all on her own. Honestly? It was nice to see someone finally stand up to her.
Yeah, well that's what I keep telling Jenny she needs to do.
Oh, that would never work for Jenny.
No. My friend Allison, and I used to try that, and it just made our lives miserable. So now we just ignore her.
Mostly. See, Allison's boyfriend studies Psychology in college, and we were in a chatroom with him and a few of his classmates, and-

A chatroom? Ohmigod, It's this cool new thing where you can talk on your computer to a bunch of people at once. It's totally rad. But yeah, like, anyway, we were chatting, and they told us how they learned in class that, like, most bullies just try and control the lives of their victims because of their own insecurities and, like, lack of control.
Yeah, so we figure the less we let her feel like she impacts our lives, the less she'll bother in the first place.
For the most part? But, it doesn't appear to protect against collateral damage.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BECCA leaves. SARA moves to sit down with MISSY and ASHLEY. JENNY walks up to them, they all grow quiet)

characterAction.tagContent: Can I talk to you for a moment?

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA looks to MISSY and ASHLEY. They take the hint and nod. They smile at JENNY and then step away. JENNY sits down, and there is a long moment. Then they both start at the same time)
(They laugh)

characterAction.tagContent: I guess at least in some ways we are the same person.
About that. Look, I'm really sorry for what I said yesterday. You were right, that wasn't fair of me.
But that's just it, I wasn't. You know, ever since you popped up in my world, I think I've been feeling a little bit jealous.
Jenny, I am literally a figment of your imagination. Until just a couple of days ago, I wasn't even alive.

But you are alive now. You moved from this concept, this fantasy version of myself to the real deal. And now I feel like I'm stuck competing with you at every step of the way. And that this real version of myself is somehow obsolete now that the fantasy is here.
You just... You always know what to say, and you don't take anyone else's crap. I thought, I don't know, that if I acted a little more like you, maybe things would change for me.
But that's not you. You don't need to force yourself to be some sort of person that you're not.

stgdContent.tagContent: (On cue, JOSH sheepishly walks to the table)

characterAction.tagContent: Why don't you tell him yourself.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY looks up to see JOSH. He is a bit nervous, she is instantly frozen. SARA stands up and sneaks away)

characterAction.tagContent: So, I, uh, wanted to thank you for your tip about the bread.
I mean, I know it may sound a little lame, but that's sort of the most anyone has talked with me in the few weeks I've been here.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JOSH looks around)

characterAction.tagContent: Have you seen me talking to anyone?
I guess talking to the new kid is still a little weird for some. But anyway. I just wanted to say that was pretty cool of you.
Your friend told me that it's not easy for you to reach out like that, so it meant a lot to me.
Yeah. He said you don't do that sort of thing for just anyone, so I wanted to say I appreciate it.
Yeah, "he". Kind of weird little guy. Says he goes by "The Jimster"?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY realizes what JIMMY did for her)

characterAction.tagContent: No one actually calls him that, do they?
Okay. Well, I'll let you get back to your lunch.
It's Thursday, so.. I wouldn't eat the bread.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JOSH is incredibly awkward now, and turns to leave)
(JOSH turns around, perhaps a bit too quickly)

characterAction.tagContent: How would you like to go to the Sadie Hawkins with me tomorrow night?

stgdContent.tagContent: (JOSH brightens up)

characterAction.tagContent: (Trying to play it cool, but failing)
I would, um.. I would like that very much.
Yeah. Awesome. Uh, pick you up at 7?
It's like you read my mind.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JOSH smiles and walks away. Instantly SARA, MISSY, and ASHLEY come running up. They've been listening the whole time)

characterAction.tagContent: Ohmigod. Did you just ask him to the dance?
See, maybe being yourself isn't the end of the world after all.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY, HEATHER, and TIFFANY walk up)

characterAction.tagContent: Aww, did the little dweebette find her prince dweeb to take her to the ball? What did you do, promise to never talk to him again if he said yes?

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA moves to get in her face, but JENNY stops her)

characterAction.tagContent: Brittany. I don't have the time, energy, or slightest care to go through these motions with you today. Whatever your problem is, you're going to have to figure that out on your own. I have a dance to plan for.

stgdContent.tagContent: (Before BRITTANY can say anything, JENNY walks past her and exits. MISSY and ASHLEY follow quickly, wide-eyed. SARA stays back for a second)

characterAction.tagContent: You know, Brittany, if you spent half as much time building yourself up as you do tearing others down, you probably wouldn't be nearly as miserable as you seem.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY is fuming by now)
(BRITTANY and HEATHER leave. TIFFANY sticks around for a second)

characterAction.tagContent: Why do you put up with her?
She's not really that bad most of the time.
I know she is like totally heinous at school, but when we're not here, she can like, be really nice sometimes.
Having a hard time seeing that, but if you say so.

Like, just last night, she spent almost three hours trying to help Heather study for her English test. She even got this new program on her computer that's supposed to help her. (beat) I just wish there was some way to help her let her guard down, so that people can see more of the real her.

sceneStructure.sceneDescription: LIGHTS UP on MISSY and ASHLEY sitting at a table. SARA enters and begins walking towards the table, when she almost runs into BECCA.

stgdContent.tagContent: (ALLISON doesn't even look up)

characterAction.tagContent: Yes, I'm Allison. No, I won't do your homework for you. Yes, I'm serious. And No, I don't care that you "really" need it.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BECCA glances up to see who it is. She coughs, and eventually elbows ALLISON)

characterAction.tagContent: Oh. You're the new girl, right? Sara, without an H. Jenny's cousin, yeah?
Becca here told me about what you did for her the other day.
What can I do for you?
I was serious, I won't do your homework.
Wait, do people really ask you that?

stgdContent.tagContent: (BECCA nods vigorously)

characterAction.tagContent: You wouldn't believe how often they do. Is that what you wanted?
No, sorry. I came to ask a different favor. It's about Brittany Maddox

stgdContent.tagContent: (ALLISON turns back to her homework)

characterAction.tagContent: Not. Interested. I want absolutely nothing to do with her, tweedledum, or tweedledee. I stay out of their way, they stay out of my way. It's how it's always been, and I have no intention of changing that.

stgdContent.tagContent: (Long pause)

characterAction.tagContent: You know it was Brittany who almost got Becca an F on that project? She's not going to just stop, either. Not unless we give her a reason to stop.

stgdContent.tagContent: (ALLISON looks over to BECCA)

characterAction.tagContent: You didn't say it was Brittany who wrecked your project.
I know you don't like her, and I figured you would have just told me I need to avoid her. But you can't just avoid her. She walks on water at Shermont High. Everybody loves her.
Except maybe Heather. I swear that girl thinks Brittany is the next Madonna or something.
What did you have in mind?
Well, I heard that you have a computer at home, is that right?
What are you doing after school today?

sceneStructure.sceneDescription: LIGHTS UP on ALLISON and BECCA sitting down, with a dozen books opened in front of them. They are busy studying. After a few moments, SARA walks up.

Moving Pictures' "Never" plays throughout the following montage. While the montage takes place, the entire stage is being turned into a dance hall. Even those setting up the stage seem to be bouncing to the music. First: MISSY and ASHLEY are sitting down. JENNY comes in wearing a dress. They both shake their heads. JENNY walks back off. Second: SARA, ALLISON, and BECCA sit around a computer. SARA is typing onto it. Third: TIFFANY is at another computer. BRITTANY and HEATHER are looking at dresses behind her. She waves over BRITTANY. Fourth: JENNY enters wearing another dress. MISSY and ASHLEY shake their heads much more vigorously this time. JENNY deflates, and walks back off. Fifth: SARA, ALLISON, and BECCA are back at the computer. Sixth: BRITTANY is now at the computer. TIFFANY and HEATHER watch. Seventh: JENNY comes back out, MISSY and ASHLEY cheer. This is the look. Eighth: JIMMY is dressed up. He checks himself in the mirror. Then he does a little dance move. JIMMY exits.

characterAction.tagContent: Huh? Oh, yeah. It's just, um, well honestly, this is my first dance.
Yeah. I didn't really do these kind of things at my old school. I mean, I wanted to, I just, well I didn't really have a ton of friends. I more kept to myself, you know?
Yeah. I mean, that probably makes me sound like some kind of dork or something, but-

stgdContent.tagContent: (Beat)

(JENNY nods. JOSH leads her to the dance floor where they dance. Meanwhile: JIMMY enters and looks around the room. He notices SARA, who is talking with someone else. JIMMY turns the other way, closes his eyes, and takes a deep breath, psyching himself up. Just as he turns to walk towards her, BRITTANY and HEATHER are in his way)

characterAction.tagContent: Can you remind me what the theme of tonight's dance is?

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY turns on HEATHER)

characterAction.tagContent: Not the dress code, the type of dance it is.

stgdContent.tagContent: (HEATHER looks really confused. BRITTANY gestures up to the big "Sadie Hawkins" sign hanging on the wall)

characterAction.tagContent: Oh. Yeah! It's a Sadie Hawkins.
(back to JIMMY) And what is supposed to happen at a Sadie Hawkins dance?

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY rolls her eyes. Hard. She's about to strangle her friend)

characterAction.tagContent: No, you idiot. I mean before the dance. What is supposed to happen before one goes to a Sadie Hawkins Dance.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY screams in frustration)

characterAction.tagContent: Yeeeaaahh, okay. I'm going to let you two... do whatever it is that you're trying to do, and be literally anywhere else.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JIMMY makes to move past BRITTANY, but she shoves him hard. SARA notices this from across the room)

characterAction.tagContent: And exactly where do you think you're going, hoser? You're only allowed to be here if a girl from this school invited you.
So unfortunately for you, your mom doesn't count.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JIMMY is stunned. He stammers a bit. Then he tries to move past them)

characterAction.tagContent: Sorry, dork brain, rules are rules.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY starts to grab JIMMY, but SARA arrives and puts her arm around him. SARA stares down BRITTANY, who cowers a bit)

characterAction.tagContent: Jim Jam! I was wondering when you were going to get here. You had me thinking you might go ahead and stand a girl up.
Wouldn't that be embarrassing? Having no date to the Sadie Hawkins. I can't even imagine. You girls know what I mean.
Oh. I'm sorry. You two aren't here.. alone.. are you?
(Beat as BRITTANY fumes, then to JIMMY)
Come on, Jim Jam. You promised me you'd dance with me at least once.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY storms off in the opposite direction. HEATHER doesn't know what to do, so she starts dancing. SARA and JIMMY move to the Punch table. JIMMY hands SARA a cup)

characterAction.tagContent: Thank you for that. Brittany seems out for blood tonight.
She's just like that because she thinks she's being stood up.

I may have had a little help pretending to be someone else on a computer, and then convinced her to ask "me" to the dance tonight. That's why she is hovering by the door in the first place. Waiting for a guy with a white suit and a bright red boutonniere to walk in.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JIMMY is shocked)

characterAction.tagContent: That's actually pretty awful. I mean, if anyone deserves it, it's Brittany Maddox, but still. She's going to be mega pissed when she finds out.
I have a feeling she'll be just fine. I said I pretended to be someone else, not that the someone else doesn't actually exist.

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA motions over to IAN, who is stepping down from his DJ booth, wearing a white suit, and a red boutonniere. IAN moves to BRITTANY)

characterAction.tagContent: Isn't that the foreign exchange student?
Ian. Yeah, turns out he thinks she is hilarious or something. I think a lot must get lost in translation.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BRITTANY is angry at first, but then IAN offers her a matching corsage, and she softens)

characterAction.tagContent: Why poke the bear when you can give it what it is really looking for?
What we all are looking for. To feel like we're needed.
I don't think I've ever seen her make that face before.

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA laughs)

characterAction.tagContent: Still, thank you. I owe you big time.
Well I know how you are going to repay me.
Well we are at a dance. Why don't you show me what you've got.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JIMMY grins. He leads her out to the dance floor, as Kenny Loggins' "Footloose" starts to play. The crowd circles around and all start to dance, as JIMMY totally owns the dance floor. After a little bit, everyone moves in and dances too. Music shifts to Orchestral Manoeuvres In The Dark's "If You Leave" As the dance continues, SARA notices ALLISON and BECCA standing off to the Punch table. She moves over to them)

characterAction.tagContent: Why aren't you two out there dancing?

stgdContent.tagContent: (BECCA shakes her head)

characterAction.tagContent: Come on. Are you telling me you don't want to be out there. Not even a little bit?

stgdContent.tagContent: (They both hesitate)

characterAction.tagContent: You have the rest of your life to take things so seriously. You are allowed to have a little bit of fun now and again.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BECCA looks to ALLISON)

characterAction.tagContent: I guess we could let loose a little. It is a dance after all. Right?
There we go! Come on. Without thinking, if you could do anything you want right now, no matter how crazy, what would that be?

stgdContent.tagContent: (ALLISON looks around)

characterAction.tagContent: I want to jump up on this table.

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA gestures to the table. ALLISON looks around, and then, hesitantly at first, climbs up on top. After a moment she yells in excitement)
(MR. WHITE comes running over)

characterAction.tagContent: WHAT ON EARTH DO YOU THINK YOU ARE DOING! GET DOWN FROM THERE!!

stgdContent.tagContent: (ALLISON jumps down. At first she looks ashamed, then she looks at SARA and they all start giggling. SARA leads them to the dance floor. MR. WHITE starts re-organizing the table when MS. KEATING walks up to get some punch. MR. WHITE looks over to MS. KEATING, and stops working on the table to grab some punch himself. MS. KEATING is standing by the punch bowl lightly bouncing to the music. After a few moments, MR. WHITE walks up. They are watching students dance throughout the following:)
(MS. KEATING nods, then looks at MR. WHITE questioningly)

characterAction.tagContent: You know, "Rad". It's what the kids are all saying. It means,
Yes, Mr. White. I know what it means. I meant, what is it you think is
Oh. Yeah. This. All of this
. Our dances were never this "hoppin'" were they?
Yeah. Our dances. Like when we were back in high school. They were never this rad.
Mr. White, with all due respect. You do know that I only graduated high school, like, six years ago, right? I've actually danced to this song, in this very gym before.

stgdContent.tagContent: (MR. WHITE keeps nodding, realizing his grave mistake)

characterAction.tagContent: I actually think you were even a chaperone at a couple of them.

stgdContent.tagContent: (MR. WHITE stares off into the distance. Realizing how out of place he is)
(Awkward moment. Suddenly stern, and not at all cool anymore, MR. WHITE storms off towards IAN and BRITTANY who are dancing a little too closely)

characterAction.tagContent: Hey, you two! I said two feet apart. Don't make me get out my yardstick!

stgdContent.tagContent: (Across the stage, JENNY breaks free from the dance floor with a huge smile on her face. MISSY and ASHLEY walk up to her)

characterAction.tagContent: Where did Jimmy learn to move like that?
One thing's for sure, I don't think he's going to have any trouble finding a date to prom.
I swear, if Sara doesn't hurry up and make a move, I might be at the front of that line.
What? I have a soft spot for geeks. I mean, I'm your friend aren't I?
Let's get back out there before someone else steps in.

stgdContent.tagContent: (ASHLEY smiles and shrugs. They both move back to dance as SARA walks up)

characterAction.tagContent: It's all going how you fantasized it would, then?

stgdContent.tagContent: (SARA is confused)

characterAction.tagContent: This... This is so much better than some fantasy. This is reality. I think at some point I got so caught up with what could happen, that I lost sight of what I actually wanted to happen.
Sounds like my work here is done then.
You're not sticking around? I think Jimmy has started to grow a little fond of you.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY smiles. Beat)
(SARA smiles back. She looks at the crowd dancing around JIMMY)

characterAction.tagContent: I think he'll be just fine.
You're going to be fine too.
Can't have me sticking around. Gotta let go of that fantasy at some point, right?

stgdContent.tagContent: (After a long moment. JENNY reaches out and gives SARA a huge hug. SARA hugs her back)

characterAction.tagContent: Stick around for a little bit more?
Not itching to get rid of me just yet?
Nah. I think this is one fantasy that we can let play out a little longer.

stgdContent.tagContent: (JENNY reaches out and grabs SARA's hand, and then pulls her back to the crowd. Modern English's "Melt With You" starts to play. Everyone is back in the center and dancing. No student is alone, and everyone is having a blast)
END OF ACT

sceneStructure.sceneDescription:
LIGHTS UP on IAN the DJ. His station is off to one side of the stage. He kicks off the dance with Starship's "Nothing's Gonna Stop Us Now". After dance scene is entirely set, LIGHTS UP on Shermont High School's cafeteria, which is now entirely set up as the Sadie Hawkins dance.

EVERYONE is dressed in awesome 80's clothes. There is a big banner that reads "Shermont High's Sadie Hawkins" center stage.

Opposite the DJ, there is a table with a punch bowl.

There is an archway made of balloons near the punch table. After a few moments, JENNY enters with JOSH around her arm. JENNY is beaming, but JOSH seems visually nervous.
